info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 17 at 6:29AM CDT until July 17 at 8:08PM CDT by NWS Kansas City/Pleasant Hill MO
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kansas...
Stranger Creek at Easton affecting Atchison and Leavenworth Counties.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kansas...
Tomahawk Creek at Roe Avenue Overland Park affecting Johnson County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Tomahawk Creek at Roe Avenue Overland Park.
* WHEN...Until this evening.
* IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Water approaches the northbound lane of Tomahawk Creek Parkway.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:01 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 13.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.7 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
This product along with additional weather and stream information is available at www.weather.gov/kc/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING
